intro: Peplis indica, commonly known as the Indian peplis, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with slender stems and finely divided leaves. Its small, yellowish-white flowers are clustered in umbels, a common feature among members of its family. Peplis indica is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
